newsitem.title: USA: Output seen steady at ARCO Los Angeles plant.
newsitem.headline: Output seen steady at ARCO Los Angeles plant.

text.p: Production at ARCO Products Company's Los Angeles crude oil refinery remains steady Tuesday despite an airborne release of steam, diesel and kerosene over the weekend, according to traders.
Two relief valves on crude oil refining units spewed a mist of petroleum products early Sunday, resulting in a brief shutdown of a nearby highway, the company said in statement Monday.
The incident failed to tighten local supplies of refined product, or raise wholesale prices this week, according to U.S. West Coast traders of refined petroleum products.
"Small glitches don't affect prices," said one California-based broker.
ARCO Products, a division of oil giant Atlantic Richfield Co, said earlier it accepted responsibility for the clean up and has brought in state agencies to monitor air quality following the incident.
